title: Ascension Cellars 2016 Siren Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is deep mauve in color and redolent of clove, vanilla and cherries. A grippy, plum- and orange-like tang marks the palate, while cherry warmth carries the finish.

title: Aymara 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of tomato, herbs, plastic and berries are decent but minimal. This feels chunky due to modest acidity, while lightly baked, herbal plum and berry flavors are regular through the finish.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A ripe yeasty wine in a variation of a classic Provencal skittle bottle, with red fruits and a nutty character. It is fat, full with plenty of citrus fruitiness. With a crisp aftertaste, it is bright at the end.

title: Clos des Amis 2015 Olivelands Vineyards Chardonnay (Ventura County)
description: Light white peach and apple aromas show off this boutique bottling from one of the few commercial projects in Ventura County. There'a plenty of tension on the palate, with tangy citrus and buttery nut flavors, which ultimately feel a little soft.

title: Collection des Anges 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A smooth and soft wine, this is packed with ripe fruit and attractive balanced acidity. There is a layer of caramel as well as spicy raspberry that give the wine extra warmth. Drink now.

title: Damiani NV Dolce Bianco White (Finger Lakes)
description: A veritable fruit punch of honeydew, cantaloupe and white-peach flavors, this sweet juicy wine is approachable and appealing. Striking acidity startles the midpalate but freshens the finish nicely.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Colombard-Sauvignon Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Accounting for 60% of the blend, the herbal Colombard beats out the equally herbal Sauvignon Blanc (the remaining 40%) in this light blend. The wine does have a soft side that is expressed in some ripe apple and apricot fruitiness. The wine is fruity, crisp and ready to drink.

title: Château Barbeiranne 2016 L'Ange Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is all about red fruit and citrus tones. Combined they make a delicious refreshing wine. It is crisp and bright, with fine tangy acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Château de Gaudou 2015 Domaine de Gaudou Exception Malbec-Merlot (Côtes du Lot)
description: This open and fruity expression of Malbec is helped to softness by its ripe Merlot. The wine is floral, fruity and lightly touched by tannins. Red-fruit flavors and a crisp aftertaste add balance to this ready-to-drink wine.

title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is the entry-level wine from this quality estate. It is simple, fruity and ripe with attractive red fruits. Brightly crisp, it is ready to drink.

title: Barnard Griffin 2015 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is still coming out of its shell, with lightly reduced aromas of mandarin orange, fresh flowers, and citrus. It drinks bone dry, with silky-feeling fruit flavors providing intrigue but not entirely delivering. The aromas and flavors don't seem to match up.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2015 Frances Amelia Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Vibrant lemon and tangerine acidity freshens savory tones of pressed apples and nuts in this slightly rustic earthy Riesling. It's dry on the palate and finishes briskly.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2015 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Straightforward flavors of pressed apple and lemon are slicked with honey and spice in this light off-dry Riesling. It's not a deeply persistent wine but the finish is refreshingly citrusy.

title: Summers 2013 Checkmate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This simple wine is thick with fruit-forward dark cherry and currant elements that find companionship in coffee, graphite and dried herb accents.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Retrofollies Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: The wine's name and label harkens back to the glory days of the French Riviera. To taste, though, it is thoroughly modern with clean crisp fruit and attractive bright red-currant acidity. Pale in color and full of fruit, this is ready to drink.

title: Nativ 2015 Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: This simple red opens with prune and baking spice scents that follow through to the round, accessible palate, along with blackberry jam and cut grass notes. Drink soon.

title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Lemon, butter and marshmallow flavors follow rich butterscotch aromas as this medium-bodied, soft-textured wine spreads its unctuous, candied flavors across the palate. It's very tasty in an extreme, buttery style.

title: Layer Cake 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: An herbal, earthy aroma is followed by crisp fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It's tart and tangy on the palate, those leafy, green notes persisting through the finish.

title: Lenz Moser 2015 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Fleshy, ripe plum fruit is immediately apparent on the nose. The palate echoes similar flavors, albeit in a more dilute form. This is full of easy fruit with a slightly smoky edge. An uncomplicated, juicy wine for drinking while the flavors are still fresh.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine de Paris Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This smooth wine has a soft and fruity character. It is very open, accessible and with a lightly zesty texture. The wine has a perfumed crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Pinot Rosé (Marlborough)
description: This unspecified rosé blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris offers bold cherry and cantaloupe aromas, some confected, bubblegum-like flavors and a clean, short finish.

title: Maryhill 2016 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This pale pink colored wine offers appealing aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher and cherry. It drinks off dry with mouthwatering cherry flavors.

title: Goose Bay 2014 Kosher Pinot Grigio (South Island)
description: Melon, baking spices and citrus pith come together in this medium- to full-bodied wine that finishes with a slightly bitter edge. Drink up.

title: Goyette 2013 Meritage (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky oak and grippy tannin support rich red and black fruit in this Bordeaux-inspired blend, which offers moderate acidity and structure.

title: Filón 2015 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry aromas come with a modest green note. This feels grabby, rubbery and tannic. Baked black-fruit flavors are herbal and minty, while an oak-driven flavor of bacon provides a smoky meaty cover. This feels blocky and a touch hot on the finish.

title: Hogue 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Stone-fruit aromas of nectarine and ripe peach drizzled with honey are followed by medium-plus sweet fruit flavors. It's a straight-forward easy drinker.

title: Hugl-Wimmer 2016 Wimmer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's peardrop fruitiness is evident right away. Fresh but slightly dilute, It's a very light, easy-drinking party wine with a dry finish. Drink now.

title: Estandon 2016 Domaine de Caseneuve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This pale wine is light, bright and fruity. It has a tangy edge along with plenty of crisp acidity. The aftertaste is clean, packed with fruitiness with a soft texture.

title: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)
description: A slight candied glaze accents forward fruity apple and tangerine flavors in this full-bodied Chardonnay. Soft sunny acidity and an expansive weighty mouthfeel marks the midpalate. Drink now.

title: Monteci 2016  Lugana
description: Spring flower, yellow stone fruit and tomato vine aromas lead to a linear palate laced with grapefruit and a hint of green melon. Vibrant acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
